testing_tools: Custom malicious scripts, OWASP ZAP, Burp Suite
test_scenarios: ["CLR Access Bypass","Infinite Loop (DoS)","Memory Exhaustion (DoS)","Prototype Pollution","Filesystem/Network Access from JS"]
acceptance_criteria: Zero sandbox escapes. All resource limit violations are caught and logged correctly.
reporting_requirements: Detailed penetration test report; Entry in risk register.
trend_analysis: Track number of attempted vs. successful bypasses over time (should always be zero).

test_scenarios: ["Access protected endpoints as unauthenticated user","Access Admin-only endpoints as 'Viewer' role","Attempt CRUD on another user's resources (if applicable)"]
acceptance_criteria: All unauthorized requests must be rejected with a 401 or 403 status code. No data leakage.
trend_analysis: Maintain 100% pass rate for all RBAC tests.

test_scenarios: ["Directly inspect the database file to confirm script content is not plaintext","Automated test to write a script, read it back, and confirm decryption is successful","Verify disaster recovery procedure for encryption keys"]
acceptance_criteria: Sensitive data (script content) must be stored in an encrypted format in the database.
reporting_requirements: Sign-off on manual verification as part of release checklist.

test_scenarios: ["Attempt to modify an audit log entry via any application API","Verify that the storage mechanism (e.g., write-only storage, blockchain) prevents tampering at the data layer","Review data retention policy enforcement"]
acceptance_criteria: No application-level functionality exists to alter or delete audit logs. Tamper-detection mechanisms are functional.
trend_analysis: Track any detected tampering attempts (should be zero).
